answers.answer: Are you taking any medications like an antidepressident that could be causing you problms? If not it could be that you are now out of the honeymoon stage in your relationship and are moving into the comfortable stage. If this is the case, I would suggest trying new things together. Believe me I don't know a person out there that doesn't wish that the honeymoon stages was forever.

Well the only med that is new within the last 6 months is metformin for diabetes prevention... but I'm not sure that that should be effecting my arousal-abilities.  And we tend to experiment and try new things anyway... It's just all very frustrating because my boyfriend is blaming himself and thinks I am no longer attracted to him.  I'm only 20 years old, this seems so young to "settle" into a relationship.
Once I think one of my .. pores?  got clogged. It was sore nub there that I finally "popped" and it felt like old dry vaginal juice. Things are fine now.

question: My current boyfriend and I have been together for over a year, and our sex life has always been one of the best parts of our relationship.  We've always shared a heightened desire to make love above that of other people we know.  But lately I feel like that's declined for me a lot, and it has occurred rather quickly, not steadily over time.  I also used to get super wet, not just inside but outside as well.  Now, even the few times I do get aroused and want sex, I don't get very wet at all.  Anyone have any tips/suggestions?
title: Wetness
